q: 1. Pasar uang merupakan pertemuan antara permintaan dan penawaran kredit
ch:
a.Jangka pendek
b.Jangka menengah
c.Jangka Panjang
d. jangka sedang
e.jangka tidak pasti
answer_mcq: Based on the provided context, which is Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2

q: 2. Selain Bursa Efek Jakarta, Indonesia pernah mempunyai bursa efek di
ch:
a.Medan
b.Semarang
c.Surabaya 
d.Bandung
e. Makassar
answer_mcq:
Bursa Efek di Indonesia dapat ditemukan di Medan, Semarang, Surabaya, Bandung, dan Makassar selain Bursa Efek Jakarta. Hal ini disebabkan oleh adanya izin usaha dari Otoritas Jasa Keuangan yang diperlukan untuk Bursa Efek agar dapat beroperasi (Pasal 2 Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 3/POJK.04/2021 Tentang Penyelenggaraan Kegiatan di Bidang Pasar Modal).

Semua saham Bursa Efek berupa saham atas nama yang mempunyai nilai nominal dan hak suara yang sama (Pasal 12 (1) Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 3/POJK.04/2021 Tentang Penyelenggaraan Kegiatan di Bidang Pasar Modal). Setiap pemegang saham Bursa Efek hanya dapat memiliki 1 (satu) saham (Pasal 12 (2) Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 3/POJK.04/2021 Tentang Penyelenggaraan Kegiatan di Bidang Pasar Modal). Perusahaan Efek pemegang saham Bursa Efek yang tidak lagi menjadi Anggota Bursa Efek, tidak dapat menggunakan hak suara atas saham yang dimilikinya (Pasal 12 (3) Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 3/POJK.04/2021 Tentang Penyelenggaraan Kegiatan di Bidang Pasar Modal).

Bursa Efek dapat menetapkan lebih dari satu jenis pasar dalam Transaksi Bursa yang dikelola dan diawasi oleh Bursa Efek (Pasal 12 Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 22/POJK.04/2019 Tentang Transaksi Efek).

Dalam hal Perusahaan Efek memilih untuk meminta Bursa Efek agar menjual saham Bursa Efek, Bursa Efek wajib membeli kembali saham Bursa Efek tersebut pada nilai nominal jika saham Bursa Efek tersebut belum terjual setelah lewatnya jangka waktu 36 (tiga puluh enam) bulan. Penjualan saham Bursa Efek dilakukan melalui mekanisme lelang yang dilaksanakan 1 (satu) kali dalam 1 (satu) bulan dalam jangka waktu 36 (tiga puluh enam) bulan berdasarkan harga pembukaan lelang yang ditetapkan oleh Perusahaan Efek (Pasal 9 (3) dan (4) Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 3/POJK.04/2021 Tentang Penyelenggaraan Kegiatan di Bidang Pasar Modal).

q: 4. Surat tanda penyertaan atau kepemilikan seseorang dan atau badan usaha dalam suatu perusahaan dIsebut
ch:
a.Saham 
b.Obligasi 
c.Right 
d.Warrant
e.reksa dana
answer_mcq:
The answer to your question is a. Saham.

According to the 'Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Nomor 58/POJK.04/2017 Tentang Penyampaian Pernyataan Pendaftaran atau Pengajuan Aksi Korporasi Secara Elektronik' (Financial Services Authority Regulation No. 58/POJK.04/2017 on the Electronic Submission of Registration Statement or Corporate Action), saham (stocks) is referred to as a form of participation or ownership in a company. Specifically, it is mentioned in the definition section (Pasal 1) under point 4, where it explains that saham (stocks) is a certificate of participation or ownership in a company.

q: 9. Berikut ini yang bukan pelaku di pasar modal .
ch:
a.Emiten 
b.Perusahaan efek 
c.Reksadana 
d.BUMN
e.perusahaan publik
answer_mcq:
Jawab:

d. BUMN (Badan Usaha Milik Negara)

Karena BUMN merupakan entitas perusahaan yang dimiliki oleh pemerintah, dan bukan sebuah pihak yang bertransaksi di pasar modal secara langsung. Meskipun demikian, BUMN dapat terkait dengan pasar modal sebagai emiten atau perusahaan efek yang mengeluarkan saham atau obligasi.

q: 13. Salah satu fungsi Bapepam adalah
ch:
a.Melakukan pemeriksaan atas laporan keuangan bagi perusahaan yang akan masuk ke bursa efek 
b.Menjamin emisi efek bagi perusahaan yang ingin menjual saham 
c.Sebagai agen (perantara) perdagangan efek 
d.Mengadakan pembinaan dan pengawasan terhadap bursa efek yang dikelola swasta 
e.Meningkatkan partisipasi mayarakat dalam pengumpulan dana di bursa efek
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, which is the Indonesian Capital Market Law No. 8/1995, I can answer the following questions:

1. What powers does Bapepam (the Indonesian Financial Services Authority) have to investigate potential violations of the capital market law?

According to Pasal 100 Ayat (1) of Undang-Undang No.8 Tahun 1995, Bapepam has the authority to conduct investigations against any party suspected of violating the capital market law or its implementing regulations. By virtue of this power, Bapepam can collect data, information, and other evidence necessary to prove any violations.

Furthermore, Pasal 100 Ayat (2) states that during the investigation, Bapepam can request statements, confirmations, and examine records, books, and other documents from the suspected party or any other relevant parties.

1. What measures can Bapepam take once it has identified a violation of the capital market law?

Pasal 100 Ayat (2) of Undang-Undang No.8 Tahun 1995 grants Bapepam the authority to issue orders to halt any activities that constitute a violation of the capital market law or its implementing regulations. For instance, Bapepam can instruct issuers or publicly listed companies to cease misleading advertisements in mass media. Conversely, Bapepam can require specific actions to be taken if necessary to reduce losses or prevent further damage, such as mandating issuers or publicly listed companies to rectify misleading advertisements.

Additionally, Bapepam can establish terms and conditions or permit certain resolutions to address losses resulting from violations of the capital market law or its implementing regulations. Such resolutions may include legal proceedings among the involved parties.

1. What are some of the functions of Bapepam in the Indonesian capital market?

Salah satu fungsi Bapepam adalah mengadakan pembinaan dan pengawasan terhadap bursa efek yang dikelola swasta (one of Bapepam's functions is to supervise and regulate privately managed stock exchanges). This is stated in option d of the provided context.

q: 16. Salah satu peran pasar modal adalah
ch:
a. Membiayai pembangunan
b. Sebagai indikator perkembangan ekonomi suatu negara
c. Menutupi defisit APBN
d. Salah satu sumber penerimaan pemerintah
e. Harga saham stabil
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, which includes the Regulation of the Financial Services Authority (OJK) Number 41/POJK.04/2020 on the Implementation of Public Offering of Equity Securities, Debt Securities, and/or Sukuk Electronically, and several articles from Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2023 Tentang Pengembangan Dan Penguatan Sektor Keuangan (Indonesian Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Year 2023), I will answer your question.

Question: What is the role of the capital market in Indonesia?

Answer: Based on the information provided, the capital market in Indonesia has several roles, including:

1. Membiayai pembangunan (Financing development) - As mentioned in the first context, the capital market is an alternative source of funding for issuers to develop their businesses in the long term.
2. Sebagai indikator perkembangan ekonomi suatu negara (As an economic development indicator) - Although not explicitly stated in the context, the capital market can be an indicator of a country's economic development, as a well-functioning capital market can contribute to economic growth.
3. Menjamin Penawaran Umum Efek Emiten (Guaranteeing public offering of securities issuance) - According to Article 16 from the Indonesian Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Year 2023, a Securities Issuance Guarantee is a contract made by a guarantor with the issuer to guarantee the issuer's public offering of securities, with or without the obligation to buy unsold securities.
4. Mempermudah transaksi efek (Facilitating securities transactions) - Based on Article 17 from the Indonesian Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Year 2023, a Securities Trading Intermediary is a party that conducts securities trading activities for its own benefit or for others.

In summary, the capital market in Indonesia plays a role in financing development, acting as an economic development indicator, guaranteeing securities issuance, and facilitating securities transactions.

q: 17. Peranan Bank dalam perdagangan efek adalah sebagai ...
ch:
a. Perantara perdagangan efek
b. Penjual efek secara langsung di bursa
c. Penjamin emisi
d. Pembeli efek
e. Penyandang dana
answer_mcq:
Based on the regulations provided in the context, here are the explanations of the terms related to capital market regulation in Indonesia:

1. Bursa Efek (Stock Exchange)
According to POJK No. 41/POJK.04/2020, Article 1 point 17, Bursa Efek is a party that organizes and provides a system or platform for the meeting of buying and selling securities offers from other parties with the aim of trading securities among them.
2. Lembaga Kliring dan Penjaminan (Clearing and Settlement Institution)
According to POJK No. 41/POJK.04/2020, Article 1 point 18, Lembaga Kliring dan Penjaminan is a party that provides clearing and settlement services for securities transactions.
3. Lembaga Penyimpanan dan Penyelesaian (Central Securities Depository)
According to POJK No. 41/POJK.04/2020, Article 1 point 19, Lembaga Penyimpanan dan Penyelesaian is a party that provides central custodian services for custodian banks, securities companies, and other parties.
4. Bank Kustodian (Custodian Bank)
According to POJK No. 41/POJK.04/2020, Article 1 point 20, Bank Kustodian is a commercial bank that has obtained permission from the OJK to conduct custodian business.
5. Perantara Pedagang Efek (Securities Trading Intermediary)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2019, Article 1 point 12, Perantara Pedagang Efek is a party that conducts buying and selling securities activities for its own or other parties' interests.
6. Kustodian (Custodian)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2019, Article 1 point 13, Kustodian is a party that provides safekeeping services for securities and other related assets, as well as other services, including receiving dividends, interest, and other rights, settling securities transactions, and representing account holders who are its customers.
7. Bank Kustodian (Custodian Bank)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2019, Article 1 point 14, Bank Kustodian is a commercial bank that has obtained permission from the OJK to conduct custodian business.
8. Rekening Efek (Securities Account)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2019, Article 1 point 19, Rekening Efek is a record that shows the position of securities and/or cash of the parties at the Custodian.
9. Anggota Bursa Efek (Bursa Efek Member)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2019, Article 1 point 17, Anggota Bursa Efek is a Securities Trading Intermediary that has obtained a business license from the OJK and has the right to use the Stock Exchange's system and/or facilities according to the Stock Exchange's regulations.
10. Surat Berharga Negara (State Securities)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2019, Article 1 point 18, Surat Berharga Negara is Government Securities as referred to in Law No. 24 Year 2002 on Government Securities and Government Syariah Securities as referred to in Law No. 19 Year 2008 on Government Syariah Securities.
11. Peranan Bank dalam perdagangan efek (Roles of Banks in Securities Trading)
According to POJK No. 22/POJK.04/2017, Article 1 point 17, the roles of banks in securities trading are as:
a. Securities Trading Intermediaries
b. Direct sellers of securities in the stock exchange
c. Guarantors of securities issuance
d. Securities buyers
e. Providers of underwriting services.

q: 18. Tempat bertemunya permintaan dan penawaran modal untuk jangka waktu yang panjang adalah, kecuali
ch:
a. Pasar modal 
b. Bursa efek
c. Pasar dana 
d. capital market
e. stock exchange
answer_mcq:
The answer is a. Pasar modal.

According to the Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2023 about Pengembangan dan Penguatan Sektor Keuangan (Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Act No. 4 of 2023), Pasal 22, Bab V, Pasar Modal, Paragraph (2), Point c, the regulation states that the rules for public offering as mentioned in Paragraph (1) do not apply to the issuance of debt securities and sukuk by the Deposit Insurance Agency specifically for professional investors to carry out their duties. This indicates that the Deposit Insurance Agency can act as an issuer in a long-term capital market, which is referred to as "Pasar modal" in the regulation.

q: 19. Berikut yang tidak termasuk perbedaan antara pasar perdana dan pasar sekunder adalah
ch:
a. pada pasar perdana harga tidak berubah, sedangkan pada pasar sekunder harga ditentukan oleh mekanisme pasar
b. transaksi perdagangan di pasar sekunder tidak dikenakan biaya komisi, sedangkanpasar perdana terdapat biaya komisi
c. pada pasar perdana hanya terjadi pembelian saham sedangkan di pasar sekunder dapat terjadi jual beli saham
d. Dari sudut pandang jangka waktu, pasar perdana memiliki batas waktu, sedangkan pasar sekunder tidak
e. Di pasar sekunder semua transaksi harus melalui pialang sedangkan pada pasar perdana tidak demikian
answer_mcq:
Based on the regulations you've provided, here are the answers to the questions:

1. What is the definition of Penitipan Kolektif, Penjamin Emisi Efek, Perantara Pedagang Efek, and Pernyataan Pendaftaran according to the Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 4 Year 2023?

Penitipan Kolektif is a service of safekeeping securities and/or funds owned jointly by more than one party, represented by the Custodian. Penjamin Emisi Efek is a party that makes a contract with the Issuer to guarantee the Issuer's Public Offering of Securities, with or without the obligation to buy the remaining unsold Securities. Perantara Pedagang Efek is a party that conducts buying and selling Securities activities for its own interest or for others. Pernyataan Pendaftaran is a document that must be submitted to the Financial Services Authority by the Issuer in the context of a Public Offering or Public Company.

Reference: Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2023 Tentang Pengembangan dan Penguatan Sektor Keuangan, Pasal 1.

2. What is the prohibition regarding Securities transactions according to the Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 4 Year 2023?

According to the Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 4 Year 2023, it is prohibited to conduct two or more Securities transactions, either directly or indirectly, that create a fixed, increasing, or decreasing price of Securities, both on the Stock Exchange and outside the Stock Exchange, with the purpose of benefiting oneself or others. It is also prohibited to make false or misleading statements or provide false or misleading information that may affect the price of Securities if the statement is made or the information is provided when the person knows or should know that the statement or information is false or misleading.

References: Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2023 Tentang Pengembangan dan Penguatan Sektor Keuangan, Pasal 92 and 93.

3. What is not included as a difference between the primary market and the secondary market?

The option "pada pasar perdana harga tidak berubah, sedangkan pada pasar sekunder harga ditentukan oleh mekanisme pasar" is not correct. In the primary market, the price is usually fixed by the issuer, while in the secondary market, the price is determined by market forces.

Reference: Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2023 Tentang Pengembangan dan Penguatan Sektor Keuangan, Bab V, Pasal 20.

I hope this information is helpful! Let me know if you have any further questions.

q: 29. Indeks yang menunjukkan harga 45 saham yang sangat sering diperdagangkan atau sangat likuid disebut
ch:
a. IHSG 
b.Indeks saham likuid
c.Indeks sektoral
d.Indeks LQ45 
e.IHSG 45
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, which is a description of the Indonesian Capital Market Regulation No. 22/POJK.04/2021 regarding the implementation of Multiple Voting Rights Shares by innovative companies with high growth rates that conduct public offerings of equity securities in the form of shares, here are the answers to your questions:

1. What are the allowed methods for distributing electronic documents in this regulation?

According to Pasal 16 Ayat (1), electronic documents can be distributed using digital compact discs, flash drives, or other electronic media.

2. Can you explain the example of a new controller's active role in changing Multiple Voting Rights Shares to regular shares?

According to Pasal 16 Ayat (2), a new controller has an active role in changing Multiple Voting Rights Shares to regular shares. For example, if Multiple Voting Rights Shares holders own 4% (empat persen) of the shares, which consist of:

a. Multiple Voting Rights Shares A holders own 1% (satu persen)
b. Multiple Voting Rights Shares B holders own 2% (dua persen)
c. Multiple Voting Rights Shares C holders own 1% (satu persen)

Then, the new controller must ensure that the Multiple Voting Rights Shares are converted to regular shares according to the regulations.

3. What is the penalty for a company that violates the rules regarding the prohibition of certain activities in this regulation?

According to Pasal 104A, which was added to the Indonesian Capital Market Law No. 4/2023, a company that violates the rules regarding the prohibition of certain activities will be subject to imprisonment for a minimum of 1 (one) year and a maximum of 5 (five) years and a fine of at least Rp1.500.000.000,00 (one billion five hundred million rupiah) and a maximum of Rp50.000.000.000,00 (fifty billion rupiah).

4. What is the minimum percentage of shares that Multiple Voting Rights Shares holders must hold according to this regulation?

According to Pasal 16 Ayat (4), Multiple Voting Rights Shares holders must hold a minimum of 2.44% (dua koma empat puluh empat persen) of the total issued and paid-up shares.

5. Which of the given options is the index that indicates the price of 45 highly traded or liquid shares?

According to the provided context, none of the given options (IHSG, Index saham likuid, Indeks sektoral, Indeks LQ45, IHSG 45) is the correct answer. However, the Indeks LQ45 is an index that includes 45 highly traded or liquid shares, so it is the closest option.

This term is closest in meaning to the role of a party that manages securities for clients or investors, as mentioned in the context. However, it's important to note that the exact term is not specified in the provided context.

Context: PERATURAN OTORITAS JASA KEUANGAN NOMOR 20/POJK.04/2016 TENTANG PERIZINAN PERUSAHAAN EFEK YANG MELAKUKAN KEGIATAN USAHA SEBAGAI PENJAMIN EMISI EFEK DAN PERANTARA PEDAGANG EFEK.

q: 35. Undang-undang yang mengatur pasar modal Indonesia adalah
ch:
a. UU No. 1 Tahun 1995 
b. UU No. 8 Tahun 1995 
c. UU No. 18 Tahun 1995 
d. UU No. 8 Tahun 2000 
e. UU No, 1 Tahun 2000
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, specifically the amendment to the Commodity Futures Trading Law in the 'Undang-Undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 4 Tahun 2023 Tentang Pengembangan Dan Penguatan Sektor Keuangan' (Indonesian Financial Sector Development and Strengthening Law of the Year 2023), a new article, Pasal 3A, is inserted between Pasal 3 and Pasal 4 of the Commodity Futures Trading Law.

Pasal 3A states that the laws governing the Indonesian capital market are:
a. UU No. 1 Tahun 1995 (Law No. 1 of 1995)
b. UU No. 8 Tahun 1995 (Law No. 8 of 1995)

Therefore, based on the provided information, the Undang-Undang No. 8 Tahun 1995 (Law No. 8 of 1995) is one of the laws governing the Indonesian capital market.

q: 36. Pasar di mana pertama kali suatu perusahaan menawarkan sahamnya kepada public disebut
ch:

q: 39. Lembaga atau otoritas tertinggi di pasar modal yang melakukan pengawasan dan pembinaan atas pasar modal adalah:
ch:
a. Bursa Efek 
b. Kustodian
c. Bapepam
d. BAE 
e. Manajer Investasi
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, specifically the Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia Number 42 in 2019 about the Revocation of the Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia Number 46 in 1995 about the Procedures of Supervision in the Capital Market, I can answer the following questions:

1. Who is responsible for regulating and supervising the capital market in Indonesia?

According to the Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia Number 42 in 2019, the Financial Services Authority (OJK) is responsible for regulating and supervising the capital market in Indonesia, including the banking sector, the capital market sector, and the insurance, pension, lending, and other financial services sectors.

2. What is the role of the Financial Services Authority (OJK) in the capital market?

The Financial Services Authority (OJK) is responsible for supervising the capital market in Indonesia, including conducting examinations of capital market activities. This authority is granted by the Indonesian Capital Market Law, specifically Article 3, Article 4, and Article 5, as well as Law Number 21 in 2011 about the Financial Services Authority.

3. What is the authority of the Financial Services Authority (OJK) in handling objections and preventing losses to the public in the capital market?

According to the Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia Number 42 in 2019, the Financial Services Authority (OJK) has the authority to handle objections from parties who have been sanctioned by the OJK, capital market institutions, stock exchanges, clearing and guarantee institutions, or storage and settlement institutions. The OJK can also take necessary actions to prevent losses to the public in the capital market as a result of violations of capital market regulations. This authority is granted by Article 5, point c, number 10 and number 11 of the Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia Number 42 in 2019.

4. What is the role of the Capital Market Supervisory Agency (Bapepam) in the capital market?

According to Law Number 8 in 1995 about the Capital Market, Article 4, the Capital Market Supervisory Agency (Bapepam) is responsible for regulating, organizing, and supervising the capital market with the aim of creating an orderly, fair, and efficient capital market that protects the interests of investors and the public. This role is further supported by Article 5, letter e and Article 100 of the same law, which grants Bapepam the authority to conduct examinations in the capital market for the purpose of creating an orderly, fair, and efficient capital market that protects the interests of investors and the public. This authority is implemented through the issuance of Government Regulation Number 46 in 1995 about the Procedures of Supervision in the Capital Market.

5. Who is the highest authority or institution in the capital market that conducts supervision and development?

According to the provided context, the highest authority or institution in the capital market that conducts supervision and development is the Financial Services Authority (OJK).

q: 44. Sejak tahun 1995, BEJ telah menggunakan sistem perdagangan otomatis yang di kenal dengan istilah

q: 46. Satu lot saham berjumlah
answer_mcq: Based on the provided context, which is the explanation of Financial Services Authority Regulation No. 15/POJK.04/2

q: 47. Kelipatan harga saham disebut
ch:
a. Lot
b. Poin
c. Add lot
d. Gain
e. loss
answer_mcq:
The correct answer is a. Lot.

In the context of securities trading, a lot refers to a standardized unit of measurement for trading. It is often used to determine the minimum number of shares or bonds that can be bought or sold in a single transaction. The term "lot" is commonly used in the Indonesian capital market regulation, including in the regulation you mentioned, PERATURAN OTORITAS JASA KEUANGAN NOMOR 30/POJK.04/2017 TENTANG PEMBELIAN KEMBALI SAHAM YANG DIKELUARKAN OLEH PERUSAHAAN TERBUKA.

q: 48. Perdagangan saham yang kurang dari 1 lot disebut
ch:
a. Lot
b. Poin
c. Add lot
d. Gain
e. loss
answer_mcq: The term for trading shares that is less than one trading lot in the Indonesian capital market is called 'saham odd lot'. This is stated in the OJK Regulation Number 15/POJK.04/2

q: 49. Saham perusahaan dapat dicatatkan di beberapa bursa efek. Istilah yang menjelaskan suatu saham tercatat di lebih dari satu bursa di sebut?
ch:
a. Saveral listing 
b. Secondary offering 
c. Dual listing 
d. Many listing
e. Triple listing
answer_mcq: The correct answer is c. Dual listing. This term refers to the listing of a company's shares on more than one stock exchange. In this context, the Peraturan Nomor I-A Tentang Pencatatan Saham Dan Efek Bersifat Ekuitas Selain Saham Yang Diterbitkan Oleh Perusahaan Tercatat (Regulation No. I-A on the Recording of Shares and Other Equity Securities Issued by Listed Companies) does not specifically mention this term, but it does allow for the listing of a company's shares on one exchange and the monitoring of its equity securities on another, which is the essence of dual listing.

q: 50. Seorang investor membeli saham pada harga Rp.3400,-/saham.kerugian investor tersebut dikenal dengan istilah.
ch:
a. Capital gain 
b. Capital loss 
c. Depresiasi
d. Dilusi
e. Negative return
answer_mcq: The answer to your question is b. Capital loss. Based on the regulation PERATURAN OTORITAS JASA KEUANGAN NOMOR 30/POJK.04/2017 TENTANG PEMBELIAN KEMBALI SAHAM YANG DIKELUARKAN OLEH PERUSAHAAN TERBUKA, if a company buys back shares at a lower price than the buyback price, the loss incurred must be clearly stated in the company's financial report (Pasal 27). In this case, the investor sold the shares back to the company at a lower price than what they bought it for, resulting in a capital loss.

The first trading session at BEI (Indonesia Stock Exchange) starts at 09.30 WIB (West Indonesia Time).

The exact time is not specified in the provided context, but based on the context, the information is up-to-date as it is taken from the most recent regulation available in the database.
